channel.title: Connection Problem [With Details]
channel.description:
Alright, I USED to run my own server, worked fine. Couple months later im trying it again, I can connect through localhost (duh)... But other people can't connect! I was wondering whats wrong, so here ya go!
[b]Download JDK[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/omfg.jpg[/img]
[b] I got my IP address and here is my no-ip:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp3-1.jpg[/img]
[b]No-ip DUC:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp2.jpg[/img]
[b]To PortForwarding:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/omfg-1.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/routerpf-1.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/last1.jpg[/img] Protocol is now TCP only
[b]Running the Server:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/desertpk.jpg[/img]
[b]Results:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp6.jpg[/img]
Anyone know what the dealio is? :\

item.title: Connection Problem [With Details]
item.dc:creator: @steveolicious steveolicious
item.description:
@steveolicious wrote:

[quote=“WrittenBlade, post:2, topic:222869”]To connect to your own server, you leave your Server IP blank, or use localhost or 127.0.0.1.[/quote]Yeah, might of somehow (idk how) left it out, must have OTHERS join xD.
Weird how it was working months ago and now it just completely stopped.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Problem [With Details]
item.dc:creator: @WrittenBlade WrittenBlade
item.description:
@WrittenBlade wrote:

To connect to your own server, you leave your Server IP blank, or use localhost or 127.0.0.1.

Read full topic
